channel.title: Weird client error =[
channel.description:
If I compile my client (there's nothing wrong with the compiler it works on other clients),
then this shows up:
javac: file not found: *.java Useage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Finished! Hit any button to continue...

item.title: Weird client error =[
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

Dude, the client you have must be closed source, try a de compiler

Read full topic

item.title: Weird client error =[
item.dc:creator: @wayzey wayzey
item.description:
@wayzey wrote:

[quote=“holy wtf, post:1, topic:279538”]If I compile my client (there’s nothing wrong with the compiler it works on other clients),

then this shows up:

javac: file not found: *.java
Useage: javac
use -help for a list of possible options
Finished!
Hit any button to continue…[/quote]

Right click then edit your compiler .cmd so that it opens in notepad.

It should say something along the lines of:
@echo off
title CLIENTNAME Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin\javac” *.java
pause

Now firstly find what version of jdk you have, if you have 1.6.0_11 then simply change ‘jdk1.6.0_13’ to ‘jdk1.6.0_11’
Then change ‘*.java’ to ‘filename.java’ filename being the name of the file you are trying to compile. Eg: class8.java

I don’t know how you got that to work with other clients, either the other clients had some special compiler or you’re lying but aye idc, you should be able to compile now so there.

Oh and if you are using a special kind of compiler then specify it’s name please so someone can address the issue for that piece of software and not the good old .cmd directed at javac.

Read full topic

item.title: Weird client error =[
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

There are no java files to compile.
When you compile, it converts .java (code that we can understand) to .class (code the run.bat and JVM understands)

Read full topic
